Subject: Lost contact to the server
Description:
I am a distributor and I open this ticket on behalf of a client: 
The client is ELTRADE Ltd
Sofia, Bulgaria

Here are the info: 
This morning around 10:00 AM, we added a new license key valid for the next three years. Until now, the system had been functioning normally, except for issues with updates.
Last year, shortly after the company was acquired by Netwrix, two updates were released. The first one installed successfully, but the second one failed. After several unsuccessful installation attempts and failing to open a ticket in your system, we gave up and left the issue unresolved.
Today, we made another attempt to install this update, but it failed again with the following error message:
Update goes to 62.5% it says - An error occurred. Hash does not match.
Some problems occurred during installation. Please Contact Support.
(ERROR: 2 - Number of maximum retries for this update reached, skipping this update...)
The update in question is Netwrix Endpoint Protector 5.9.4.1 (HWA-EPP4-U0066).
We managed to create an account in your system and began gathering the necessary data to open a new ticket. Shortly after, the system completely stopped functioning. The web interface is entirely unresponsive and cannot be accessed via either IP address or domain name.
We attempted to restart the system multiple times, but the issue persists.
Server ID: SIN1LC73
What_We_Know__c:
They reverted to a previous snapshot, and the server was functional again, but the update error was still present.
I removed the error and proceeded upgrading the server from 5900 to 5940.
When we tried to perform a online update for 5941, it failed again, and I had to remove the error once again.
They are waiting for the offline patch to be released.
Solution_Comment__c:
They reverted to a previous snapshot, and the server was functional again, but the update error was still present.
I removed the error and proceeded upgrading the server from 5900 to 5940.
When we tried to perform an online update for 5941, it failed again, and I had to remove the error once again.
They are waiting for the offline patch to be released.
